feed.title: Gnarly Void - tufting
feed.subtitle: Tuning the Silence Into A Harmony of Matter

entry.title: Damn Zippy inspired bird tattoo fiber art
entry.content: Inspired by more tattoo art, this piece features a colorful bird. It was originally drawn and tattooed by Olive aka Damn Zippy. Check her out here

entry.title: Traditional tattoo inspired flower fiber piece
entry.content:
A hand-tufted rug inspired by traditional tattoo flash.

This piece features a bold five-petal flower with a bright yellow center, saturated red petals, and heavy black outlines. The white halo gives the design breathing room, while the deep green leaves ground it with contrast and balance.

Built with thick pile and sharp color blocking, it's designed to read clearly from a distance and feel plush up close. The sculpted silhouette follows the leaves and petals, turning the graphic into a functional object.

Classic flash energy, translated into fiber.

entry.title: Abstract Dreamsicle
entry.content:
Exploring softness as structure.

Layered pastel forms drift and overlap, anchored by a dense, warm base that grounds the composition. Rounded protrusions interrupt the surface like half-remembered details, inviting touch as much as inspection.

I spent extra time trimming and shearing this one. I wanted the layers to look like they were on top of each other and had "depth".

entry.title: NYC MTA G Train fiber piece
entry.content:
This piece is dedicated to the G train in New York City.

The G is an odd line. It does not touch Manhattan. It runs quietly through Brooklyn and Queens, connecting places that feel adjacent but rarely centered. It is often overlooked, often delayed, and deeply relied on by the people who use it every day.

Rendered in soft fiber, the familiar green circle becomes tactile and slow. What is usually signage and schedule turns into something physical - dense, imperfect, and worn at the edges. The letterform holds its shape, but only just. The pile absorbs sharpness. The symbol becomes an object.

Like the train itself, this piece is about persistence rather than spectacle. About movement that happens off to the side. About systems that are lived in more than they are noticed.

A transit mark translated into texture.

entry.title: Color Experiment #1
entry.content: What started out as an experiment with a random yarn color I found turned into a fiber piece with a blast of color that I love. It gives me 90s psychadelic vibes.

entry.title: A Tribute to My Lord and Savior, Vyvanse
entry.content: A blue and white capsule inspired by Vyvanse. I was diagnosed later in life and this medicine has improved my life in ways I couldn't imagine. I used to think I was just lazy or apathethic, but turns out my brain just functions differently.

entry.title: King Gizzard and the Lizard Wizard Alligator Fiber Art
entry.content:
Process

I'm a big fan of King Gizz and wanted to create a piece inspired by them. The alligator is available in a simple 2d outline that was perfect for tufting. I decided to mount it on a thin piece of birch that I painted bright purple. I got the paint in the samples section for $2 and I think it provides a perfect backdrop.

This is an early piece so there are still some rough edges. The top of the back could have been a thicker outline. I also chose not to give it pupils as I didn't think it would look very good as a small dot of yarn.

Materials

Yarn

  • acrylic

Wood

  • birch

entry.title: Geometric Color Block Hand-tufted Rug
entry.content:
Process

Started this as a wall hanging. Tufted the top left black square first, then added the center squares. Halfway through I got a new long pile tufting machine and decided to pivot it into a rug instead. You can see the longer pile in the beige corners - that's where I started using the new machine. The rest is shorter pile from the original wall hanging plan.

Materials

Yarn:

  • Acrylic
  • Wool

entry.title: Mondrian-esque Purple, Gold, and Black Hand-tufted Rug
entry.content: My first rug. I recently got a tufting machine and wanted to start simple. The black square came first, then I decided to add a few rows of purple. After that, I decided a gold border would look good.
